column1:
MicDobbe,"2014-08-16T13:29:57.37Z","Good mini version AAT","

Good microfighter with a good minifigure.

column2: with small instruction manual (10*14cm) which has 15 pages and there are 28 steps.

column1: Not very special parts, some rounded to give it the AAT-look.
There is one Pilot Droid (blue torso) included which obviously is not exclusive but a good minifigure to get as it is not just another regular droid.

column2: t take a lot of time but I found it amusing to put it together.

column1: As it is a symmetric model a lot of the building is just mirrored.
It has two flick-fire missiles and a fully rotating gun on top.
I like that they used the round pieces on the bottom to give it that hovering feel and it makes it easy to move around on most surfaces.
The Droid fits right in the cockpit and it has a place to store his small blaster.
I thought this was going to be my least favorite microfighter but it turned out very different,
It is an pretty accurate miniature version of the AAT and lots of fun to play with.
The price/piece ratio is about 10 cents so for Star Wars I like it.

column1: Overall opinion This is the best microfighter till now. You can buy even a few of these if you want to build some kind of army. I would recommend this to a Lego Star Wars collector, mostly to the Episode 1 and droid army collectors. If you want to test what you think of microfighters I would recommend you to start with this.

,TRUE,5,5,5,4,4 Odeinoichus","2017-01-04T18:21:43.81Z","Weakest Series 1 Microfighter","

Set #75029 AAT: Microfighters are an impressive looking set of micro-scaled chibified vehicles from the Star Wars universe. I decided to skip discussing the packaging in these reviews because there really isn&rsquo
column2: t much to say. You basically have a box with a design that shows off the set, the features and a cross-promotion for the game and other sets in the series. And the instructions really are just standard LEGO instructions.

column1: Anyway those are my reasons for losing the discussion on those elements. That being said let&rsquo

column2: s a squat, fat awkward looking tank. The build uses fairly standard pieces without any really rare ones in the set. The steps are also fairly straightforward, without any tricky steps.

column1: The huge open space for the pilot is a bit unfortunate for this design though, considering the tank is one vehicle that could get away with hiding the pilots station behind the tank turret, the fact that they left this huge open space just makes for an odd design choice. The two side cannons are black telescopes on flick-fire missiles, so you can shoot cannons at other vehicles.
The turret is nice, it turns and the cannon on top is a nice design choice. It&rsquo
column2: s really a nice microfighter, it is however up to tastes and I can see where some might not like it because it is too squat and less streamlined.
d recommend this only to those who want a complete series collection. It isn&rsquo

,TRUE,3,3,3,3,3 DJ_Bricks2","2016-02-15T11:42:06.94Z","Great Set","

A good set produced by LEGO, one of the less ridiculous-looking Micro-Fighters.
- Great box design and clear, easy to follow instructions.
- No parts missing and useful spares.
- Good pilot droid Minifigure, different to the others due to its angled arm that holds the blaster pistol.
- Good fun to build and doesn'
- A good build, with flick-fire missiles and a rotating main cannon this is a small but effective design by LEGO.
My overall opinion would be that the model is well structured but, like all Micro-Fighters still looks ridiculous but not as much as the others. 4.5/5 Stars

column1: The build of this set is a nice little build for what it is. Not the best Microfighter build out there but any Star Wars fan can look at it and recognize what it is supposed to represent.
Like most LEGO sets, the building process was smooth and easy.
